required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diabetic Retinopathy in HIV Subjects Treated With EGRIFTA®
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind Clinical Trial to Evaluate Whether EGRIFTA® (Tesamorelin for Injection), 2 mg Once Daily SC, Increases the Risk of Development or Progression of Diabetic Retinopathy When Administered to HIV-infected Subjects With Abdominal Lipohypertrophy and Concomitant Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: To show the non-inferiority of EGRIFTA® vs. placebo in the development or progression of Diabetic Retinopathy in HIV-infected subjects with concomitant abdominal lipohypertrophy and Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).

detailed_description.textblock: To date, EGRIFTA® has not been studied for longer than 1 year in human subjects, nor has EGRIFTA® been studied in Type 2 diabetic HIV-infected subjects who are receiving oral hypoglycemic agents, GLP-1 analogues, or insulin. The present study will assess the potential of EGRIFTA® to induce or exacerbate DR in HIV-infected subjects on antiretroviral therapy who have concomitant abdominal lipohypertrophy and T2DM, and explore the long-term effects of EGRIFTA® on glycemic control and major adverse cardiovascular event (MACE) in this population.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in percentages of subjects with a 3-step or greater progression (from both eyes) on the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) PERSON scale.
primary_outcome.description: Subjects will undergo an opthamologic examination including fundus photographs at 3 month intervals for duration of 36 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in HbA1c by intensification of concomitant diabetic treatment
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c values will be obtained at screening at month 3, 6, 12, 18, 24, 30 and 36

arm_group.description: Sterile, lyophilized, nonpyrogenic powder containing tesamorelin acetate with mannitol as excipient

intervention.description: Daily 2 mg subcutaneous injections of tesamorelin

facility.name: University of California CARE Clinic, Los Angeles
Southampton Clinical Research, Inc d.b.a. Central West Clinical Research
Harold Hamm Diabetes Center at the University of Oklahoma
UT Southwestern Medical Center, Atten: HIV Research Unit
